summary: This bill, H.R. 3328, proposes the establishment of an Ambassador-at-Large for Arctic Affairs within the Department of State. The Ambassador, appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate, will represent the United States on Arctic-related matters, coordinating programs with other government agencies abroad. The Ambassador's responsibilities include national security, cooperation among Arctic countries, responsible resource management, environmental protection, indigenous peoples' involvement, and scientific research in the Arctic region.
